newsitem.title: USA: Quigley Corp director to sell holdings.
newsitem.headline: Quigley Corp director to sell holdings.

text.p: Quigley Corp said on Thursday that Robert Pollack, a director of the company, intended to sell a portion of his stock holdings for personal reasons related to estate and retirement considerations.
The holdings, acquired in 1991, will be sold in broker transactions within the next sixty days, the company said in a statement.
In addition, the company said it had registered the remaining 500,000 shares reserved for issuance after its Stock Option Plan to provide patent, trademark and securities counsel.
During the next sixty days, Quigley expects to commence litigation against one or more competitors for violations of patents related to the company's COLD-EEZE(TM) lozenge product, the company said.
